intro: Craspedaria auriseta, commonly known as the golden craspedaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers, which are typically arranged in dense, spherical clusters. The plant is native to parts of Southeast Asia and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Craspedaria auriseta is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant color and compact growth habit.
